citeinfo.title: Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS) Data Distribution System

descript.abstract: This dataset represents coastal waters and the coastline of Rhode Island, as well as portions of neighboring Connecticut, Massachusetts, and New York. Includes Narragansett Bay, salt ponds, and tributaries.
descript.purpose: This data represents Rhode Island coastal waters and its coastline, and is intended for cartographic purposes.

idinfo.useconst: These data were created for informational, planning and guidance use only. They are a general reference, not a legally authoritative source for the location of natural or manmade features. Proper interpretation of these data may requre the assistance of appropriate professional services. The cartographic representations depicted have not been verified by a RI Registered Professional Land Surveyor and are not intended to be used in place of a survey. The producer makes no warranty, express or implied, related to the accuracy, reliability, completeness, or currentness of these data. This dataset is provided 'as is.â€™ The producer(s) of this dataset, contributors to this dataset, the Rhode Island Geographic Information System (RIGIS) consortium, the State of Rhode Island, and the University of Rhode Island do not make any warranties of any kind for this dataset, and are not liable for any loss or damage however and whenever caused by any use of this dataset. Please acknowledge both RIGIS and the primary producer(s) of this dataset in any derived products. Versions of the RIGIS logo suitable for both printed and web-based products are available at http://www.rigis.org/logos.
idinfo.datacred: RI Department of Administration, Statewide Planning Program
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143

attracc.attraccr: Visually verified and considered to be accurate.

dataqual.logic: No formal testing performed, however the spatial data are generally believed to be consistent with waterbody delineations shown on USGS 7.5 minute 1:24,000 scale topographic maps
dataqual.complete: All marine and estuarine waterbodies documented in the 2008 RI Integrated Water Quality Report are included here.

horizpa.horizpar: Meets National Map Accuracy Standards for 1:24000 Scale

citeinfo.origin: Rhode Island Department of Environmental Management, Office of Water Resources
citeinfo.title: Marine and Estuarine Waters: RI Integrated Water Quality Monitoring and Assessment Report 2012; estuaries_IWQMA2012

srcinfo.srccontr: Marine and Estuarine waterbody shoreline vectors

citeinfo.origin: Rhode Island Department of Transportation, MIS/GIS Section
citeinfo.title: State, Coastline, Town Boundaries

srcinfo.srccontr: RI coastline and boundaries; the foundation for which this new dataset was built.

procstep.procdesc: CT boundary was used to erase land areas leaving a matching CT coastline. The MA boundary was then used to erase land areas leaving a matching MA coastline. Data boundary was then extended past Block Island and into surrounding MA and CT coastal waters. Added a new attibute field called 'Water,' and dissolved Esturaries_IWQMA12 dataset based on "Water = Yes." NY shoreline boundary was then used to erase land areas leaving a matching NY coastline around Fisher Island. Removed small NY Islands from the Coastal Water dataset by heads-up digitizing from ArcGIS Online World_Imagery.

Data contributed to RIGIS by the Rhode Island Department of Administration, Statewide Planning Program. Metadata were reviewed, minor corrections made to formatting and content, RIGIS distribution information added.
